# ExitStatus

**Enumeration**

An enumeration describing possible status a process will report on exit.

## Declaration

```swift
enum ExitStatus
```

## Overview

You can convert an instance of this type to an instance of [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/ExitTest/Condition] using [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/ExitTest/Condition/init(_:)]. That value can then be used to describe the condition under which an exit test is expected to pass or fail by passing it to [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/expect(processExitsWith:observing:_:sourceLocation:performing:)] or [doc://org.swift.testing/documentation/Testing/require(processExitsWith:observing:_:sourceLocation:performing:)].

## Enumeration Cases

- **ExitStatus.exitCode(_:)**: The process exited with the given exit code.
- **ExitStatus.signal(_:)**: The process exited with the given signal.

## Checking how processes exit

- **Exit testing**: Use exit tests to test functionality that might cause a test process to exit.
- **expect(processExitsWith:observing:_:sourceLocation:performing:)**: Check that an expression causes the process to terminate in a given fashion.
- **require(processExitsWith:observing:_:sourceLocation:performing:)**: Check that an expression causes the process to terminate in a given fashion and throw an error if it did not.
- **ExitTest**: A type describing an exit test.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
